
End Transmission

# BITSY VERSION 4.5

NAME tea
DLG ITM_0

DLG ITM_0
You found a nice warm cup of tea

DLG SPR_1
"""
--BEGIN TRANSMISSION--
A massive blizzard has descended on the base and the surrounding area. It came out of nowhere and the radar shows no end in sight. There wasn't time to send an emergency signal in time due to intense magnetic field disruption. The transmitter signal currently can't reach the orbiting satellite through the storm, leaving me stranded. I have enough resources for 20 days as long as the power stays on. I will continue to log updates to store in the transmitter cache until a connection to the satellite is secured.
--END TRANSMISSION--
"""

DLG SPR_2
The winds are too strong during the storm. If I went outside I would be blown away for sure. And I don't even want to think about how cold it is out there.

DLG SPR_3
Visibility is so low I can see maybe five feet out the window.

DLG SPR_4
Visibility is so low I can see maybe five feet out the window.

DLG SPR_5
I have plenty of food rations for now. Hopefully the storm clears soon so I can receive the next delivery.

DLG SPR_6
*Some papers are laid out on the table. Scribbled on them are various notes about the ice covering the planet.*

DLG SPR_7
*An ice sample preserved in a clear freezer for study.*

DLG SPR_8
I have plenty of food rations for now. Hopefully the storm clears soon so I can receive the next delivery.

DLG SPR_9
*On your desk there are sketches of the surrounding landscape.*

DLG SPR_a
*The helmet for your Envirosuit for excursions outside. The current storm is too much even for this equipment.*

DLG SPR_b
*The suit for your Envirosuit for excursions outside. The current storm is too much even for this equipment.*

DLG SPR_0
"""
--BEGIN TRANSMISSION--
A massive blizzard has descended on the base and the surrounding area. It came out of nowhere and the radar shows no end in sight. There wasn't time to send an emergency signal in time due to intense magnetic field disruption. The transmitter signal currently can't reach the orbiting satellite through the storm, leaving me stranded. I have enough resources for 20 days as long as the power stays on. I will continue to log updates to store in the transmitter cache until a connection to the satellite is secured.
--END TRANSMISSION--
"""

DLG SPR_c
No more rations. I'm so hungry I could probably eat the shelf.

DLG SPR_d
This is the last of the fire I'll be able to make. I've run out of things to burn, not that there was much to begin with. Nearly everything is metal in this lab, I've had to start burning my bed and even some rations to stay warm.

DLG SPR_e
I had to break out the ice sample to boil down for water. Ironic, this frozen hellscape is at least providing me with water to stay hydrated long enough to starve and freeze to death.

DLG SPR_f
*The research table is bare. All the papers have been Burned for warmth. Of course only after you had uploaded their findings to the transmitter.

DLG SPR_g
*The stand for your envirosuit. You're wearing it currently for the extra warmth it provides.*

DLG SPR_h
*Your personal desk is empty. Everything from sketches to photos of loved ones were burned for warmth.*

DLG SPR_i
"""
--BEGIN TRANSMISSION--
This is it for me. All data I have has been uploaded. Since I lost power six days ago I've been turning on the reserves to vent smoke from fire and transmit these messages. I knew what I was getting into with this assignment but I didn't want it to end like this. At least I have no one that will miss me. I don't know when this will reach anyone, or when this damned storm will end, but I hope it's soon. I'm out of food and things to burn for warmth, so I don't expect to last much longer. Power reserves are low, and I won't be able to send any more messages. Farewell.
--END TRANSMISSION--
"""

END 0


END undefined
The storm ended 200 days later. Once it cleared all of your transmissions were sent. At the same time orbiting rescue ships waiting to land after the storm cleared descended to the surface. Buried under 100 feet of snow was your base. It took three days to dig out your body. Your body was returned to Earth where nearly 60 people attended your funeral. Your sacrifice was memorialized and safety features were completely revised to prevent what happened to you from ever happening again.

VAR a
42
